alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Letcher; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:28AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Letcher, southeastern Knott, southeastern Floyd and Pike Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 528 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Justell to Elko. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Coal Run, Boldman, Osborn and Grethel around 535 AM EDT. Whitesburg, Zebulon, Dongola, Day, Whitco, Marlowe, Bellcraft, Meta, Southdown and Partridge around 540 AM EDT. Raccoon, Oven Fork, Eolia, Chloe, Ermine, Colly, Garden Village, Mayking, Shelbiana and Maggard around 545 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Kimper, Phyllis, Fishtrap Lake, Marrowbone, Belcher, Biggs, Fedscreek, Mouthcard, Toonerville and Coleman. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 8. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 5. U.S. Highway 23 in Lethcher County between mile markers 1 and 7. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 0 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
